definition: ocean/sea/CL:個|个[ge4],片[pian4]/great number of people or things/(dialect) numerous

sentences.english: SO it is caalled"PRECIOUS SHIP ". this majestic ship was the biggest seagoing vessel in the world at that time .
sentences.chinese: 它體勢龐大，巨無匹敵，是當時世界上最大的海船。

sentences.english: It is a major port of entry served by a deepwater channel that accommodates oceangoing ships. Population, 98,962.
sentences.chinese: 是主要的貨物進口港，有可容納海船的深水道。

sentences.english: The water compartment vessel ushered in a new epoch of ocean shipping.
sentences.chinese: 水密隔艙海船開闢了人類遠洋航海的新紀元。

sentences.english: After the sea-ship, after the whistling winds.
sentences.chinese: 相約海船後，笛風微入我喉。

sentences.english: No, but I think it's about ships.
sentences.chinese: 沒有，我想可能是關於海船的。

sentences.english: Now it has already been applied to a number of Sea-going ships, and the results are good.
sentences.chinese: 目前此法已應用於某些海船上，收到了良好的效果。

sentences.english: High winds were battering the ship.

definition: Chinese treasure ship, a type of large sailing ship in the fleet of Ming dynasty admiral Zheng He 鄭和|郑和[Zheng4 He2]
